text: Bandwidth is a Communications Platform as a Service (CPaaS) company, founded in 1999 by David Morken and Henry Kaestner in 2001. The company specializes in selling software application programming interfaces (APIs) for voice and messaging, leveraging their proprietary IP voice network. It went public in 2017 on the NASDAQ, raising $80 million in capital. As of 2020, Bandwidth plans to relocate its headquarters in Raleigh, North Carolina, announcing plans to hire around 1,000 new employees. == References == Category:American software companies
title: Bandwidth (company)
